articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, Yomna Mohamed
articles.description: Hopes are fading that Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi and his foreign minister have survived a helicopter crash in mountainous terrain and icy weather, an Iranian official said on Monday after search teams located the wreckage.
articles.title: Iranian President Raisi feared dead as helicopter wreckage found

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ebrahim Raisi, who died aged 63, rose through Iran's theocracy from hardline prosecutor to uncompromising president, overseeing a crackdown on protests at home and pushing hard in nuclear talks with world powers as he burnished his credentials to position himself to become the next supreme leader.
articles.title: Iran's President Raisi took hard line with national protests and nuclear talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi, a hardliner long seen as a potential successor to Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, was killed in a helicopter crash in mountainous terrain near the Azerbaijan border, officials and state media said on Monday.
articles.title: Reactions to the death of Iran's president in a helicopter crash

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The prosecutor of the International Criminal Court on Monday said it had requested arrest warrants against Israeli Prime Minisiter Benjamin Netanyahu and Denfense Minister Yoav Gallant for alledged war crimes in Gaza.
articles.title: ICC prosecutor seeks arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu and Defense Minister Gallant

articles.author: Ted Hesson, Jason Lange
articles.description: About half of U.S. voters oppose putting immigrants in the country illegally into detention camps while awaiting deportation, a new Reuters/Ipsos poll shows, suggesting Americans may be wary of harsher enforcement plans Donald Trump is considering.
articles.title: Half of Americans oppose immigrant detention camps, Reuters/Ipsos poll finds

articles.author: Sudipto Ganguly, Swati Bhat, Jatindra Dash
articles.description: Indians began voting early on Monday in the fifth phase of mammoth general elections, with thousands queuing at polling stations to beat the scorching heat in the financial capital of Mumbai and the sprawling states of Uttar Pradesh and Odisha.
articles.title: Indians vote early in fifth phase of polls to avoid scorching heat

articles.author: Fatos Bytyci, Florion Goga
articles.description: On the roof of the mayor's office in Albania's capital Tirana, lesbians Alba Ahmetaj and Edlira Mara held an unofficial wedding ceremony on Sunday, a symbolic move they hope will promote LGBT+ rights in the conservative Balkan country.
articles.title: In loving protest, Albanian lesbians marry unofficially

articles.author: Michael Holden, Sam Tobin
articles.description: A British court could give a final decision on Monday on whether WikiLeaks' founder Julian Assange should be extradited to the United States over the mass leak of secret U.S. documents, the culmination of 13 years of legal battles and detentions.
articles.title: WikiLeaks' Julian Assange faces US extradition judgment day

articles.author: Paul Sandle
articles.description: Britain's infected blood scandal that has killed 3,000 people and left thousands more suffering with hepatitis or HIV was no accident, a public inquiry found on Monday, blaming a catalogue of failures by government and doctors.
articles.title: UK's infected blood scandal could and should have been avoided, inquiry finds

articles.author: Dave Sherwood
articles.description: The Dominican Republic's Luis Abinader, who is set for a second term after winning a preliminary 58.85% in Sunday's vote, inherited a nightmare scenario when he first took office as president in August 2020.
articles.title: Dominican Republic's president-elect Abinader takes tough stand on graft, Haiti
